bibl.title: Ng Kwack Kang v. King County. Return of Respondent
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US District Court Western Division of Washington, Seattle

div1.p:
United States District Court, Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of NG KWACK KANG for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
No. 3156 Return
To the Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the District Court of the United States, for the Western District of Washington: Now Comes the respondent, Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration at the port of Seattle, and for answer to the writ of habeas corpus herein, says that he here produces the body of Ng Kwack Kang, the person named in the petition for said writ, in obedience to the command and direction thereof, and for further return and answer to said writ, here avers that he detained in his custody the body of the said Ng Kwack Kang for deportation from the United States, as an alien and Chinese person not entitled to admission under the laws of the United States, under and by virtue of an order of the Secretary of Commerce and Labor of the United States, issued to him, said respondent, on October 21, 1915, which said order is in the words and figures following, that is to say: "5400/86 Oct. 21, 1915 Commissioner of Immigration, Seattle, Wash. Acknowledging the receipt of your letter of the 20th ult., No. 32,828, forwarding appeal record in the case of Ng KwookKwack Kang, you are advised that, after careful consideration of the evidence presented in the record, the Assistant Secretary has affirmed the excluding decision and directed deportation. Alfred Hampton Assistant Commissioner-General
MGC Incl. 54

Respondent attaches hereto the record, decision, and exhibits, both on the hearing before said Commissioner and on appeal to the Secretary of Labor, which constitute a part of this return. And now the respindent having fully answered, prays that the said writ may be discharged, and that he may be awarded his costs about his return to the writ aforesaid in this behalf expended.
Henry M. White Commissioner of Immigration
The United States of America Western District of Washington, Northern Division } SS.
Henry M. White, being first duly sworn, upon his oath deposes and says: That he is the Commissioner of Immigration named in the foregoing return; that he has read the said return, knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be true.
Henry M. White Subscribed and sworn to before me this 3rd day of December, 1915.
Albert Moodie Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.

No. 3157 In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington. Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of NG KWACK KANG for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
RETURN
Filed in the U.S. District Court Western District of Washington, Northern Division Dec 8, 1915 Frank L. Crossby, Clerk
